content:
# I successfully harvested 10 iron ore, bringing my total to 10 iron ore in the inventory, along with 5 coal and 9 iron plates.
# Now I can return to the furnace to continue the smelting process.

# I will insert 5 coal into the furnace for fuel and then insert 5 iron ore to produce the necessary iron plates.

insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace_entity, quantity=5)  # Inserting 5 coal for fuel
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace_entity, quantity=5)  # Inserting 5 iron ore into the furnace for smelting

# Now, I will check the furnace's inventory and status after these insertions.
furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace_entity)  # Inspecting the furnace's inventory
print(f"Furnace Inventory: {furnace_inventory}")  # Checking what's in the furnace's inventory

# After that, I'll wait for the furnace to smelt the iron ore into plates.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum wait of 30 seconds
    furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace_entity)
    if furnace_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 1:  # Check if at least 1 iron plate has been produced
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    print("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")  # Notify if no plates are produced

# After waiting, I will check if there are any iron plates produced in the furnace to extract them.
furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace_entity)  # Check the inventory again after waiting
if furnace_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) > 0:  # Ensure there are plates to extract
    extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace_entity.position, quantity=furnace_inventory[Prototype.IronPlate])  # Extract the produced plates

# Finally, I will check the inventory after extraction.
print(f"Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()}")  # Inspecting the inventory after extracting iron plates
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")  # Displaying any updates on the entities
